#' above `p1` is larger than `tU`, and stopped for Futility if the posterior

                    		
                  

                  

                    195
                    
                    
                      
#' probability to be below `p0` is larger than `tL`:

                    		
                  

                  

                    196
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    197
                    
                    
                      
#' Stop criteria for Efficacy :

                    		
                  

                  

                    198
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    199
                    
                    
                      
#' `Pr(truep > p1) > tU`

                    		
                  

                  

                    200
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    201
                    
                    
                      
#' Stop criteria for Futility :

                    		
                  

                  

                    202
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    203
                    
                    
                      
#' `Pr(truep < p0) > tL`

                    		
                  

                  

                    204
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    205
                    
                    
                      
#' Resulting operating characteristics include the following:

                    		
                  

                  

                    206
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    207
                    
                    
                      
#' - `ExpectedN`: expected number of patients in the trials

                    		
                  

                  

                    208
                    
                    
                      
#' - `PrStopEarly`: probability to stop the trial early (before reaching the

                    		
                  

                  

                    209
                    
                    
                      
#' maximum sample size)

                    		
                  

                  

                    210
                    
                    
                      
#' - `PrEarlyEff`: probability of Early Go decision

                    		
                  

                  

                    211
                    
                    
                      
#' - `PrEarlyFut`: probability of for Early Stop decision

                    		
                  

                  

                    212
                    
                    
                      
#' - `PrEfficacy`: probability of Go decision

                    		
                  

                  

                    213
                    
                    
                      
#' - `PrFutility`: probability of Stop decision

                    		
                  

                  

                    214
                    
                    
                      
#' - `PrGrayZone`: probability between Go and Stop ,"Evaluate" or Gray decision zone

                    		
                  

                  

                    215
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    216
                    
                    
                      
#' @inheritParams h_get_looks

                    		
                  

                  

                    217
                    
                    
                      
#' @inheritParams h_get_decision

                    		
                  

                  

                    218
                    
                    
                      
#' @typed sim : number

                    		
                  

                  

                    219
                    
                    
                      
#'  number of simulations.

                    		
                  

                  

                    220
                    
                    
                      
#' @typed wiggle : flag

                    		
                  

                  

                    221
                    
                    
                      
#'  generate random look locations (not default).

                    		
                  

                  

                    222
                    
                    
                      
#'  if `TRUE`, optional to specify `dist` (see @details).

                    		
                  

                  

                    223
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    224
                    
                    
                      
#' @return A list with the following elements:

                    		
                  

                  

                    225
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    226
                    
                    
                      
#' - `oc`: matrix with operating characteristics (see @details section)

                    		
                  

                  

                    227
                    
                    
                      
#' - `nn`: vector of look locations that was supplied

                    		
                  

                  

                    228
                    
                    
                      
#' - `nnE`: vector of Efficacy look locations

                    		
                  

                  

                    229
                    
                    
                      
#' - `nnF`: vector of Futility look locations

                    		
                  

                  

                    230
                    
                    
                      
#' - `params`: user input arguments.

                    		
                  

                  

                    231
                    
                    
                      
#

                    		
                  

                  

                    232
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    233
                    
                    
                      
#' @example examples/ocPostprob.R

                    		
                  

                  

                    234
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    235
                    
                    
                      
ocPostprob <- function(nnE, truep, p0, p1, tL, tU, parE = c(1, 1),

                    		
                  

                  

                    236
                    
                    
                      
                       sim = 50000, wiggle = FALSE, nnF = nnE) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    237
                    6x
                    
                      
  nn <- sort(unique(c(nnF, nnE)))

                    		
                  

                  

                    238
                    6x
                    
                      
  assert_number(sim, lower = 1, finite = TRUE)

                    		
                  

                  

                    239
                    6x
                    
                      
  assert_flag(wiggle)

                    		
                  

                  

                    240
                    6x
                    
                      
  if (sim < 50000) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    241
                    5x
                    
                      
    warning("Advise to use sim >= 50000 to achieve convergence")

                    		
                  

                  

                    242
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    243
                    6x
                    
                      
  decision <- vector(length = sim)

                    		
                  

                  

                    244
                    6x
                    
                      
  all_sizes <- vector(length = sim)

                    		
                  

                  

                    245
                    6x
                    
                      
  for (k in seq_len(sim)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    246
                    1e+05x
                    
                      
    if (length(nn) != 1 && wiggle) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    247
                    !
                    
                      
      dist <- h_get_distance(nn = nn)

                    		
                  

                  

                    248
                    !
                    
                      
      nnr <- h_get_looks(dist = dist, nnE = nnE, nnF = nnF)

                    		
                  

                  

                    249
                    !
                    
                      
      nnrE <- nnr$nnrE

                    		
                  

                  

                    250
                    !
                    
                      
      nnrF <- nnr$nnrF

                    		
                  

                  

                    251
                    
                    
                      
    } else {

                    		
                  

                  

                    252
                    1e+05x
                    
                      
      dist <- 0

                    		
                  

                  

                    253
                    1e+05x
                    
                      
      nnrE <- nnE

                    		
                  

                  

                    254
                    1e+05x
                    
                      
      nnrF <- nnF

                    		
                  

                  

                    255
                    
                    
                      
    }

                    		
                  

                  

                    256
                    1e+05x
                    
                      
    nnr <- unique(c(nnrE, nnrF))

                    		
                  

                  

                    257
                    1e+05x
                    
                      
    tmp <- h_get_decision(

                    		
                  

                  

                    258
                    1e+05x
                    
                      
      nnr = nnr,

                    		
                  

                  

                    259
                    1e+05x
                    
                      
      truep = truep, p0 = p0, p1 = p1,

                    		
                  

                  

                    260
                    1e+05x
                    
                      
      parE = c(1, 1), nnE = nnrE,

                    		
                  

                  

                    261
                    1e+05x
                    
                      
      nnF = nnrF, tL = tL, tU = tU

                    		
                  

                  

                    262
                    
                    
                      
    )

                    		
                  

                  

                    263
                    1e+05x
                    
                      
    decision[k] <- tmp$decision

                    		
                  

                  

                    264
                    1e+05x
                    
                      
    all_sizes[k] <- tmp$all_sizes

                    		
                  

                  

                    265
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    266
                    6x
                    
                      
  oc <- h_get_oc(all_sizes = all_sizes, nnr = nnr, decision = decision, nnrE = nnrE, nnrF = nnrF)

                    		
                  

                  

                    267
                    6x
                    
                      
  list(

                    		
                  

                  

                    268
                    6x
                    
                      
    oc = oc,

                    		
                  

                  

                    269
                    6x
                    
                      
    Decision = decision,

                    		
                  

                  

                    270
                    6x
                    
                      
    SampleSize = all_sizes,

                    		
                  

                  

                    271
                    6x
                    
                      
    union_nn = nnr,

                    		
                  

                  

                    272
                    6x
                    
                      
    wiggled_nnrE = nnrE,

                    		
                  

                  

                    273
                    6x
                    
                      
    wiggled_nnrF = nnrF,

                    		
                  

                  

                    274
                    6x
                    
                      
    dist = dist,

                    		
                  

                  

                    275
                    6x
                    
                      
    params = as.list(match.call(expand.dots = FALSE))

                    		
                  

                  

                    276
                    
                    
                      
  )

                    		
                  

                  

                    277
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                
              

            

            

              

                
                  

                    1
                    
                    
                      
#' @include dbetabinom.R

                    		
                  

                  

                    2
                    
                    
                      
#' @include postprob.R

                    		
                  

                  

                    3
                    
                    
                      
NULL

                    		
                  

                  

                    4
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    5
                    
                    
                      
#' The Posterior Beta Mixture Integrand when `delta` is relative

                    		
                  

                  

                    6
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    7
                    
                    
                      
#' The helper function to generate Integrand function when `relativeDelta = TRUE`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    8
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    9
                    
                    
                      
#' @typed delta : number

                    		
                  

                  

                    10
                    
                    
                      
#'  margin by which the response rate in the treatment group should

                    		
                  

                  

                    11
                    
                    
                      
#'  be better than in the standard of care or control or `S` group.

                    		
                  

                  

                    12
                    
                    
                      
#'  Note that this can also be negative, e.g. when non-inferiority is being assessed.

                    		
                  

                  

                    13
                    
                    
                      
#' @typed p_s : number

                    		
                  

                  

                    14
                    
                    
                      
#'  probability of success or response rate of standard of care or control or `S` group.

                    		
                  

                  

                    15
                    
                    
                      
#' @typed activeBetamixPost : list

                    		
                  

                  

                    16
                    
                    
                      
#'  a list of posterior parameters of a beta-mixture-binomial distribution with generic names

                    		
                  

                  

                    17
                    
                    
                      
#'  `par` and `weights`. See [h_getBetamixPost()].

                    		
                  

                  

                    18
                    
                    
                      
#' @typed controlBetamixPost : list

                    		
                  

                  

                    19
                    
                    
                      
#'  a list of posterior parameters of a beta-mixture-binomial distribution with generic names

                    		
                  

                  

                    20
                    
                    
                      
#'  `par` and `weights`. See [h_getBetamixPost()].

                    		
                  

                  

                    21
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    22
                    
                    
                      
#' @return Function that is an argument for [stats::integrate()].

                    		
                  

                  

                    23
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    24
                    
                    
                      
#' @keywords internal

                    		
                  

                  

                    25
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    26
                    
                    
                      
h_integrand_relDelta <- function(p_s, delta, activeBetamixPost, controlBetamixPost) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    27
                    6x
                    
                      
  cdf <- postprob(

                    		
                  

                  

                    28
                    6x
                    
                      
    x = 0, # Needed for Vectorize()

                    		
                  

                  

                    29
                    6x
                    
                      
    p = (1 - p_s) * delta + p_s,

                    		
                  

                  

                    30
                    6x
                    
                      
    betamixPost = activeBetamixPost

                    		
                  

                  

                    31
                    
                    
                      
  )

                    		
                  

                  

                    32
                    6x
                    
                      
  pdf <- with(

                    		
                  

                  

                    33
                    6x
                    
                      
    controlBetamixPost,

                    		
                  

                  

                    34
                    6x
                    
                      
    dbetaMix(x = p_s, par = par, weights = weights)

                    		
                  

                  

                    35
                    
                    
                      
  )

                    		
                  

                  

                    36
                    6x
                    
                      
  cdf * pdf

                    		
                  

                  

                    37
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                  

                    38
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    39
                    
                    
                      
#' The Posterior Beta Mixture Integrand when Delta is absolute

                    		
                  

                  

                    40
                    
                    
                      
#' The helper function to generate Integrand function when `relativeDelta = FALSE`,

                    		
                  

                  

                    41
                    
                    
                      
#' a default setting.

                    		
                  

                  

                    42
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    43
                    
                    
                      
#' @inheritParams h_integrand_relDelta

                    		
                  

                  

                    44
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    45
                    
                    
                      
#' @return Function that is an argument for [stats::integrate()].

                    		
                  

                  

                    46
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    47
                    
                    
                      
#' @keywords internal

                    		
                  

                  

                    48
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    49
                    
                    
                      
h_integrand <- function(p_s, delta, activeBetamixPost, controlBetamixPost) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    50
                    10862x
                    
                      
  cdf <- postprob(

                    		
                  

                  

                    51
                    10862x
                    
                      
    x = 0, # Needed for Vectorize()

                    		
                  

                  

                    52
                    10862x
                    
                      
    p = p_s + delta,

                    		
                  

                  

                    53
                    10862x
                    
                      
    betamixPost = activeBetamixPost

                    		
                  

                  

                    54
                    
                    
                      
  )

                    		
                  

                  

                    55
                    10862x
                    
                      
  pdf <- with(

                    		
                  

                  

                    56
                    10862x
                    
                      
    controlBetamixPost,

                    		
                  

                  

                    57
                    10862x
                    
                      
    dbetaMix(x = p_s, par = par, weights = weights)

                    		
                  

                  

                    58
                    
                    
                      
  )

                    		
                  

                  

                    59
                    10862x
                    
                      
  cdf * pdf

                    		
                  

                  

                    60
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                  

                    61
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    62
                    
                    
                      
#' Generating bounds for the Integration of Beta Mixture Posterior

                    		
                  

                  

                    63
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    64
                    
                    
                      
#' Using the quantile of the Beta Mixture Distribution from parameters given by standard of care `S` or

                    		
                  

                  

                    65
                    
                    
                      
#' experimental group `E` to determine bounds as inputs to [stats::integrate()].

                    		
                  

                  

                    66
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    67
                    
                    
                      
#' @inheritParams h_integrand_relDelta

                    		
                  

                  

                    68
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    69
                    
                    
                      
#' @return Integrand function

                    		
                  

                  

                    70
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    71
                    
                    
                      
#' @keywords internal

                    		
                  

                  

                    72
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    73
                    
                    
                      
h_get_bounds <- function(controlBetamixPost) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    74
                    5686x
                    
                      
  epsilon <- .Machine$double.xmin

                    		
                  

                  

                    75
                    5686x
                    
                      
  with(

                    		
                  

                  

                    76
                    5686x
                    
                      
    controlBetamixPost,

                    		
                  

                  

                    77
                    5686x
                    
                      
    qbetaMix(

                    		
                  

                  

                    78
                    5686x
                    
                      
      p = c(epsilon, 1 - epsilon),

                    		
                  

                  

                    79
                    5686x
                    
                      
      par = par,

                    		
                  

                  

                    80
                    5686x
                    
                      
      weights = weights

                    		
                  

                  

                    81
                    
                    
                      
    )

                    		
                  

                  

                    82
                    
                    
                      
  )

                    		
                  

                  

                    83
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                  

                    84
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    85
                    
                    
                      
#' Compute the Posterior Probability with Beta Prior on standard of care `S`

                    		
                  

                  

                    86
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    87
                    
                    
                      
#' @description `r lifecycle::badge("experimental")`

                    		
                  

                  

                    88
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    89
                    
                    
                      
#' Using the approach by Thall and Simon (Biometrics, 1994), this evaluates the

                    		
                  

                  

                    90
                    
                    
                      
#' posterior probability of achieving superior response rate in the treatment group `E`

                    		
                  

                  

                    91
                    
                    
                      
#' compared to standard of care `S`. See note below for two formulations of the difference in response rates.

                    		
                  

                  

                    92
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    93
                    
                    
                      
#' @inheritParams h_integrand_relDelta

                    		
                  

                  

                    94
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    95
                    
                    
                      
#' @typed x : numeric

                    		
                  

                  

                    96
                    
                    
                      
#'  number of success counts in the `E` group.

                    		
                  

                  

                    97
                    
                    
                      
#' @typed n : number

                    		
                  

                  

                    98
                    
                    
                      
#'  number of patients in the `E` group.

                    		
                  

                  

                    99
                    
                    
                      
#' @typed xS : number

                    		
                  

                  

                    100
                    
                    
                      
#'  number of success counts in the `S` group.

                    		
                  

                  

                    101
                    
                    
                      
#' @typed nS : number

                    		
                  

                  

                    102
                    
                    
                      
#'  number of patients in the `S` group.

                    		
                  

                  

                    103
                    
                    
                      
#' @typed relativeDelta : flag

                    		
                  

                  

                    104
                    
                    
                      
#'  If `TRUE`, then a `relativeDelta` is used. Represents that a minimum

                    		
                  

                  

                    105
                    
                    
                      
#'  response rate in magnitude of `delta` of the `S` non-responding patients

                    		
                  

                  

                    106
                    
                    
                      
#'  is included as the margin between treatment and control group. See note.

                    		
                  

                  

                    107
                    
                    
                      
#' @typed parE : "`numeric` or `matrix`"

                    		
                  

                  

                    108
                    
                    
                      
#'  parameters for beta distribution. If it is a matrix, it needs to have 2 columns,

                    		
                  

                  

                    109
                    
                    
                      
#'  and each row corresponds to each component of a beta-mixture distribution

                    		
                  

                  

                    110
                    
                    
                      
#'  for the `E` group. See details.

                    		
                  

                  

                    111
                    
                    
                      
#' @typed weights : numeric

                    		
                  

                  

                    112
                    
                    
                      
#'  the non-negative mixture weights of the beta mixture prior for group `E`. See details.

                    		
                  

                  

                    113
                    
                    
                      
#' @typed parS : "`numeric` or `matrix`"

                    		
                  

                  

                    114
                    
                    
                      
#'  parameters for beta distribution. If it is a matrix, it needs to have 2 columns,

                    		
                  

                  

                    115
                    
                    
                      
#'  and each row corresponds to each component of a beta-mixture distribution

                    		
                  

                  

                    116
                    
                    
                      
#'  for the `S` group. See details.

                    		
                  

                  

                    117
                    
                    
                      
#' @typed weightsS : numeric

                    		
                  

                  

                    118
                    
                    
                      
#'  the non-negative mixture weights of the beta mixture prior for group `S`. See details.

                    		
                  

                  

                    119
                    
                    
                      
#' @return The posterior probability

                    		
                  

                  

                    120
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    121
                    
                    
                      
#' @note

                    		
                  

                  

                    122
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    123
                    
                    
                      
#' ## Delta :

                    		
                  

                  

                    124
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    125
                    
                    
                      
#' The desired improvement is denoted as `delta`. There are two options in using `delta`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    126
                    
                    
                      
#' The absolute case when `relativeDelta = FALSE` and relative as when `relativeDelta = TRUE`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    127
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    128
                    
                    
                      
#' 1. The absolute case is when we define an absolute delta, greater than `P_S`,

                    		
                  

                  

                    129
                    
                    
                      
#' the response rate of the standard of care or control or `S` group such that

                    		
                  

                  

                    130
                    
                    
                      
#' the posterior is `Pr(P_E > P_S + delta | data)`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    131
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    132
                    
                    
                      
#' 2. In the relative case, we suppose that the treatment group's

                    		
                  

                  

                    133
                    
                    
                      
#' response rate is assumed to be greater than `P_S + (1-P_S) * delta` such that

                    		
                  

                  

                    134
                    
                    
                      
#' the posterior is `Pr(P_E > P_S + (1 - P_S) * delta | data)`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    135
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    136
                    
                    
                      
#' @details

                    		
                  

                  

                    137
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    138
                    
                    
                      
#' The beta mixture prior for the `E` arm requires argument `parE` and `weights`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    139
                    
                    
                      
#' The beta mixture prior for the `S` arm requires argument `parS` and `weightsS`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    140
                    
                    
                      
#' See [postprob()] for details.

                    		
                  

                  

                    141
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    142
                    
                    
                      
#' If a beta-mixture is used, by default, the weights are uniform across the components.

                    		
                  

                  

                    143
                    
                    
                      
#' Weights can exceed 1, to which the algorithm will normalize the weights such that all weights sum to 1.

                    		
                  

                  

                    144
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    145
                    
                    
                      
#' @example examples/postprobDist.R

                    		
                  

                  

                    146
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    147
                    
                    
                      
postprobDist <- function(x,

                    		
                  

                  

                    148
                    
                    
                      
                         n,

                    		
                  

                  

                    149
                    
                    
                      
                         xS = 0,

                    		
                  

                  

                    150
                    
                    
                      
                         nS = 0,

                    		
                  

                  

                    151
                    
                    
                      
                         delta,

                    		
                  

                  

                    152
                    
                    
                      
                         relativeDelta = FALSE,

                    		
                  

                  

                    153
                    
                    
                      
                         parE = c(1, 1),

                    		
                  

                  

                    154
                    
                    
                      
                         weights,

                    		
                  

                  

                    155
                    
                    
                      
                         parS = c(1, 1),

                    		
                  

                  

                    156
                    
                    
                      
                         weightsS) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    157
                    5688x
                    
                      
  if (is.vector(parE)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    158
                    4316x
                    
                      
    assert_true(identical(length(parE), 2L))

                    		
                  

                  

                    159
                    4316x
                    
                      
    parE <- t(parE)

                    		
                  

                  

                    160
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    161
                    5688x
                    
                      
  if (is.vector(parS)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    162
                    4316x
                    
                      
    assert_true(identical(length(parS), 2L))

                    		
                  

                  

                    163
                    4316x
                    
                      
    parS <- t(parS)

                    		
                  

                  

                    164
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    165
                    5688x
                    
                      
  if (missing(weights)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    166
                    4318x
                    
                      
    weights <- rep(1, nrow(parE))

                    		
                  

                  

                    167
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    168
                    5688x
                    
                      
  if (missing(weightsS)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    169
                    4318x
                    
                      
    weightsS <- rep(1, nrow(parS))

                    		
                  

                  

                    170
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    171
                    5688x
                    
                      
  assert_number(n, lower = x, finite = TRUE)

                    		
                  

                  

                    172
                    5687x
                    
                      
  assert_numeric(x, lower = 0, upper = n, finite = TRUE)

                    		
                  

                  

                    173
                    5687x
                    
                      
  assert_number(nS, lower = 0, finite = TRUE)

                    		
                  

                  

                    174
                    5686x
                    
                      
  assert_number(xS, lower = 0, upper = nS, finite = TRUE)

                    		
                  

                  

                    175
                    5686x
                    
                      
  assert_number(delta, finite = TRUE)

                    		
                  

                  

                    176
                    5686x
                    
                      
  assert_flag(relativeDelta)

                    		
                  

                  

                    177
                    5686x
                    
                      
  assert_numeric(weights, lower = 0, finite = TRUE)

                    		
                  

                  

                    178
                    5686x
                    
                      
  assert_numeric(weightsS, lower = 0, finite = TRUE)

                    		
                  

                  

                    179
                    5686x
                    
                      
  assert_numeric(parE, lower = 0, finite = TRUE)

                    		
                  

                  

                    180
                    5686x
                    
                      
  assert_numeric(parS, lower = 0, finite = TRUE)

                    		
                  

                  

                    181
                    5686x
                    
                      
  activeBetamixPost <- h_getBetamixPost(x = x, n = n, par = parE, weights = weights)

                    		
                  

                  

                    182
                    5686x
                    
                      
  controlBetamixPost <- h_getBetamixPost(x = xS, n = nS, par = parS, weights = weightsS)

                    		
                  

                  

                    183
                    5686x
                    
                      
  assert_names(names(activeBetamixPost), identical.to = c("par", "weights"))

                    		
                  

                  

                    184
                    5686x
                    
                      
  assert_names(names(controlBetamixPost), identical.to = c("par", "weights"))

                    		
                  

                  

                    185
                    5686x
                    
                      
  if (relativeDelta) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    186
                    2x
                    
                      
    epsilon <- .Machine$double.xmin

                    		
                  

                  

                    187
                    2x
                    
                      
    integrand <- h_integrand_relDelta

                    		
                  

                  

                    188
                    
                    
                      
  } else {

                    		
                  

                  

                    189
                    5684x
                    
                      
    epsilon <- .Machine$double.xmin

                    		
                  

                  

                    190
                    5684x
                    
                      
    integrand <- h_integrand

                    		
                  

                  

                    191
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    192
                    5686x
                    
                      
  bounds <- h_get_bounds(controlBetamixPost = controlBetamixPost)

                    		
                  

                  

                    193
                    5686x
                    
                      
  intRes <- integrate(

                    		
                  

                  

                    194
                    5686x
                    
                      
    f = integrand,

                    		
                  

                  

                    195
                    5686x
                    
                      
    lower =

                    		
                  

                  

                    196
                    5686x
                    
                      
      max(

                    		
                  

                  

                    197
                    5686x
                    
                      
        bounds[1],

                    		
                  

                  

                    198
                    5686x
                    
                      
        ifelse(relativeDelta, 0, 0 - delta)

                    		
                  

                  

                    199
                    
                    
                      
      ),

                    		
                  

                  

                    200
                    5686x
                    
                      
    upper =

                    		
                  

                  

                    201
                    5686x
                    
                      
      min(

                    		
                  

                  

                    202
                    5686x
                    
                      
        ifelse(relativeDelta, 1, 1 - delta),

                    		
                  

                  

                    203
                    5686x
                    
                      
        bounds[2]

                    		
                  

                  

                    204
                    
                    
                      
      ),

                    		
                  

                  

                    205
                    5686x
                    
                      
    delta = delta,

                    		
                  

                  

                    206
                    5686x
                    
                      
    activeBetamixPost = activeBetamixPost,

                    		
                  

                  

                    207
                    5686x
                    
                      
    controlBetamixPost = controlBetamixPost

                    		
                  

                  

                    208
                    
                    
                      
  )

                    		
                  

                  

                    209
                    5686x
                    
                      
  if (intRes$message == "OK") {

                    		
                  

                  

                    210
                    5686x
                    
                      
    intRes$value

                    		
                  

                  

                    211
                    
                    
                      
  } else {

                    		
                  

                  

                    212
                    !
                    
                      
    stop(intRes$message)

                    		
                  

                  

                    213
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    214
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                  

                    215
                    
                    
                      
postprobDist <- Vectorize(postprobDist, vectorize.args = "x")

                    		
                  

                
              

            

            

              

                
                  

                    1
                    
                    
                      
#' @include dbetabinom.R

                    		
                  

                  

                    2
                    
                    
                      
#' @include postprob.R

                    		
                  

                  

                    3
                    
                    
                      
NULL

                    		
                  

                  

                    4
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    5
                    
                    
                      
#' Predictive probability of trial success

                    		
                  

                  

                    6
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    7
                    
                    
                      
#' @description `r lifecycle::badge("experimental")`

                    		
                  

                  

                    8
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    9
                    
                    
                      
#' Compute the predictive probability of trial success given current data.

                    		
                  

                  

                    10
                    
                    
                      
#' Success means that at the end of the trial the posterior probability is

                    		
                  

                  

                    11
                    
                    
                      
#' `Pr(P_E > p) >= thetaT`,

                    		
                  

                  

                    12
                    
                    
                      
#' where `p` is the fixed response rate threshold and `P_E` is the response rate in the

                    		
                  

                  

                    13
                    
                    
                      
#' treatment group or `E` group.

                    		
                  

                  

                    14
                    
                    
                      
#' Then the predictive probability for success is:

                    		
                  

                  

                    15
                    
                    
                      
#' `pp = sum over i: Pr(Y=i|x,n)*I{Pr(P_E > p|x,Y=i)>=thetaT}`

                    		
                  

                  

                    16
                    
                    
                      
#' where `Y` is the number of future responses in the treatment group and `x` is

                    		
                  

                  

                    17
                    
                    
                      
#' the current number of responses in the treatment group out of n.

                    		
                  

                  

                    18
                    
                    
                      
#' The prior for the response rate in the experimental arm is `P_E ~ beta(a, b)`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    19
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    20
                    
                    
                      
#' A table with the following contents will be included in the return output :

                    		
                  

                  

                    21
                    
                    
                      
#' - `counts`: `Y = i`, number of future successes in `Nmax-n` subjects.

                    		
                  

                  

                    22
                    
                    
                      
#' - `density`: `Pr(Y = i|x)` using beta-(mixture)-binomial distribution.

                    		
                  

                  

                    23
                    
                    
                      
#' - `posterior`: `Pr(P_E > p | x, Y=i)` using beta posterior.

                    		
                  

                  

                    24
                    
                    
                      
#' - `success`: indicator `I(b > thetaT)`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    25
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    26
                    
                    
                      
#' @typed x : number

                    		
                  

                  

                    27
                    
                    
                      
#'  number of successes.

                    		
                  

                  

                    28
                    
                    
                      
#' @typed n : number

                    		
                  

                  

                    29
                    
                    
                      
#'  number of patients.

                    		
                  

                  

                    30
                    
                    
                      
#' @typed Nmax : number

                    		
                  

                  

                    31
                    
                    
                      
#'  maximum number of patients at the end of the trial in the `E` group.

                    		
                  

                  

                    32
                    
                    
                      
#' @typed p : number

                    		
                  

                  

                    33
                    
                    
                      
#'  threshold on the response rate.

                    		
                  

                  

                    34
                    
                    
                      
#' @typed thetaT : number

                    		
                  

                  

                    35
                    
                    
                      
#'  threshold on the probability to be above p.

                    		
                  

                  

                    36
                    
                    
                      
#' @typed parE : numeric

                    		
                  

                  

                    37
                    
                    
                      
#'  the beta parameters matrix, with K rows and 2 columns,

                    		
                  

                  

                    38
                    
                    
                      
#'  corresponding to the beta parameters of the K components.

                    		
                  

                  

                    39
                    
                    
                      
#' @typed weights : numeric

                    		
                  

                  

                    40
                    
                    
                      
#'  the mixture weights of the beta mixture prior.

                    		
                  

                  

                    41
                    
                    
                      
#' @return A `list` is returned with names `result` for predictive probability and

                    		
                  

                  

                    42
                    
                    
                      
#'  `table` of numeric values with counts of responses in the remaining patients,

                    		
                  

                  

                    43
                    
                    
                      
#'  probabilities of these counts, corresponding probabilities to be above threshold,

                    		
                  

                  

                    44
                    
                    
                      
#'  and trial success indicators.

                    		
                  

                  

                    45
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    46
                    
                    
                      
#' @references Lee, J. J., & Liu, D. D. (2008). A predictive probability

                    		
                  

                  

                    47
                    
                    
                      
#'  design for phase II cancer clinical trials. Clinical Trials, 5(2),

                    		
                  

                  

                    48
                    
                    
                      
#'  93-106. doi:10.1177/1740774508089279

                    		
                  

                  

                    49
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    50
                    
                    
                      
#' @example examples/predprob.R

                    		
                  

                  

                    51
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    52
                    
                    
                      
predprob <- function(x, n, Nmax, p, thetaT, parE = c(1, 1),

                    		
                  

                  

                    53
                    
                    
                      
                     weights) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    54
                    
                    
                      
  # m = Nmax - n future observations

                    		
                  

                  

                    55
                    6217x
                    
                      
  m <- Nmax - n

                    		
                  

                  

                    56
                    6217x
                    
                      
  if (is.vector(parE)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    57
                    6212x
                    
                      
    assert_true(identical(length(parE), 2L))

                    		
                  

                  

                    58
                    
                    
                      
    # and transpose to matrix with one row

                    		
                  

                  

                    59
                    6212x
                    
                      
    parE <- t(parE)

                    		
                  

                  

                    60
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    61
                    6217x
                    
                      
  if (missing(weights)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    62
                    6211x
                    
                      
    weights <- rep(1, nrow(parE))

                    		
                  

                  

                    63
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    64
                    6217x
                    
                      
  betamixPost <- h_getBetamixPost(x = x, n = n, par = parE, weights = weights)

                    		
                  

                  

                    65
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    66
                    6213x
                    
                      
  density <- with(

                    		
                  

                  

                    67
                    6213x
                    
                      
    betamixPost,

                    		
                  

                  

                    68
                    6213x
                    
                      
    dbetabinomMix(x = 0:m, m = m, par = par, weights = weights)

                    		
                  

                  

                    69
                    
                    
                      
  )

                    		
                  

                  

                    70
                    6212x
                    
                      
  assert_numeric(density, lower = 0, upper = 1, finite = TRUE, any.missing = FALSE)

                    		
                  

                  

                    71
                    6212x
                    
                      
  assert_number(thetaT, lower = 0, upper = 1, finite = TRUE)

                    		
                  

                  

                    72
                    
                    
                      
  # posterior probabilities to be above threshold p

                    		
                  

                  

                    73
                    6211x
                    
                      
  posterior <- postprob(x = x + c(0:m), n = Nmax, p = p, parE = parE, weights = weights)

                    		
                  

                  

                    74
                    6211x
                    
                      
  list(

                    		
                  

                  

                    75
                    6211x
                    
                      
    result = sum(density * (posterior > thetaT)),

                    		
                  

                  

                    76
                    6211x
                    
                      
    table = data.frame(

                    		
                  

                  

                    77
                    6211x
                    
                      
      counts = c(0:m),

                    		
                  

                  

                    78
                    6211x
                    
                      
      cumul_counts = n + (0:m),

                    		
                  

                  

                    79
                    6211x
                    
                      
      density = round(density, 4),

                    		
                  

                  

                    80
                    6211x
                    
                      
      posterior = posterior,

                    		
                  

                  

                    81
                    6211x
                    
                      
      success = (posterior > thetaT)

                    		
                  

                  

                    82
                    
                    
                      
    )

                    		
                  

                  

                    83
                    
                    
                      
  )

                    		
                  

                  

                    84
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                
              

            

            

              

                
                  

                    1
                    
                    
                      
#' @include predprob.R

                    		
                  

                  

                    2
                    
                    
                      
#' @include postprob.R

                    		
                  

                  

                    3
                    
                    
                      
NULL

                    		
                  

                  

                    4
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    5
                    
                    
                      
#' Decision cutpoints for boundary (based on predictive probability)

                    		
                  

                  

                    6
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    7
                    
                    
                      
#' This function is used to identify the efficacy boundary and futility

                    		
                  

                  

                    8
                    
                    
                      
#' boundary based on predictive probabilities, i.e.:

                    		
                  

                  

                    9
                    
                    
                      
#' Efficacy boundary: find minimum x (xU) where

                    		
                  

                  

                    10
                    
                    
                      
#' Pr(Pr(P > p | x, Y) >= tT | x) > phiU,

                    		
                  

                  

                    11
                    
                    
                      
#' Futility boundary: find maximum x (xL) where

                    		
                  

                  

                    12
                    
                    
                      
#' Pr(Pr(P > p | x, Y) >= tT | x) < phiL

                    		
                  

                  

                    13
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    14
                    
                    
                      
#' @param nvec  a vector of number of patients

                    		
                  

                  

                    15
                    
                    
                      
#' @param Nmax  maximum number of patients at the end of the trial

                    		
                  

                  

                    16
                    
                    
                      
#' (default: maximum of \code{nvec})

                    		
                  

                  

                    17
                    
                    
                      
#' @param p  threshold on the response rate

                    		
                  

                  

                    18
                    
                    
                      
#' @param tT  threshold on the posterior probability to be above p

                    		
                  

                  

                    19
                    
                    
                      
#' @param phiL  futility boundary predictive probability threshold

                    		
                  

                  

                    20
                    
                    
                      
#' @param phiU  efficacy boundary predictive probability threshold

                    		
                  

                  

                    21
                    
                    
                      
#' @param a  the alpha parameter of a beta prior of treatment group

                    		
                  

                  

                    22
                    
                    
                      
#' @param b  the beta parameter of a beta prior of treatment group

                    		
                  

                  

                    23
                    
                    
                      
#' @return A matrix where for each sample size in \code{nvec}, this function

                    		
                  

                  

                    24
                    
                    
                      
#' returns the maximum number of responses that meet the futility

                    		
                  

                  

                    25
                    
                    
                      
#' threshold (xL), its corresponding response rate (pL), predictive probability

                    		
                  

                  

                    26
                    
                    
                      
#' (ppL) and posterior probability (postL), the upper bound of one

                    		
                  

                  

                    27
                    
                    
                      
#' sided 95% CI for the response rate based on an

                    		
                  

                  

                    28
                    
                    
                      
#' exact binomial test (UciL), and the same boundary parameters for efficacy:

                    		
                  

                  

                    29
                    
                    
                      
#' the minimal number of responses that meet the efficacy threshold (xU),

                    		
                  

                  

                    30
                    
                    
                      
#' the corresponding response rate (pU), predictive probability

                    		
                  

                  

                    31
                    
                    
                      
#' (ppL) and posterior probability (postU), the lower bound of one sided

                    		
                  

                  

                    32
                    
                    
                      
#' 95% CI for the response rate based on exact binomial test (LciU).

                    		
                  

                  

                    33
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    34
                    
                    
                      
#' @importFrom stats binom.test

                    		
                  

                  

                    35
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    36
                    
                    
                      
#' @example examples/boundsPredprob.R

                    		
                  

                  

                    37
                    
                    
                      
#' @export
